Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.1: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.2: CREW COMPANY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thecompany that runs this crew. Not all members of a crew may be employees, but maybe contractors or seconded to the crew by another company.
Column Comment.3: CREW IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the crew.
Column Comment.4: SUPPORT FACILITY CREW OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier that allowsa crew to be affilliated with a facility more than once over time.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.13: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.15: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
